data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553310,"name":"Malm","username":"Malm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/malm/{size}/180801_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T21:57:14.137Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eForgive me if this sounds like an insane question butâ€¦ does your team reuse bearings from old mechanisms, or do you treat them as single-use parts and always use fresh ones?  Prototype with old ones but buy fresh ones for the competition robot?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you do reuse them on your competition robots, how do you decide when theyâ€™ve gone bad?  Wait for them to feel loose? crunchy? Wait for outright failure?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI feel like Iâ€™m being super wasteful when I tell the students to throw away any bearing that Iâ€™m suspicious of (which is what I tend to do), but I also really donâ€™t like the times in the past Iâ€™ve had to try to hunt down a bad bearing that is causing issues in the middle of the robot.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T22:02:58.413Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":215,"readers_count":214,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495056,"topic_slug":"reusing-bearings","display_username":"Malm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26908,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reusing-bearings/495056/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3553317,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T22:01:31.251Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhenever 3946 would re-use a drive train or climber gearbox, we would always take it apart, clean and inspect the shafts and gears, replace the bearings, and re-grease.  On lighter duty gearboxes we wouldnâ€™t always replace the bearings if they seemed ok.  Of course, this was back in the bag era, so we did this shortly after the game was announced.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T22:01:31.251Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495056,"topic_slug":"reusing-bearings","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else â¬›ðŸŸ«ðŸŸ¥ðŸŸ§ðŸŸ¨ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ¦ðŸŸªâ–’â–’â¬œ\t"},"post_url":"/t/reusing-bearings/495056/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3553323,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T22:03:32.227Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe reuse more than just bearings. Pretty much any part we can, we will. If a student is suspicious of a bearing or another part being bad, we tell them to put it aside somewhere and we will investigate it later. Even if we reuse a mechanism like swerve modules, we disassemble and inspect it before putting it back together.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T22:03:32.227Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":119.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495056,"topic_slug":"reusing-bearings","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/reusing-bearings/495056/3","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557382,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T00:39:28.655Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis is confusing, or inside out.  Drive train bearings, drive train wheels, small fasteners, broken stuff, and manufactured parts then forbidden for reuse  were about the only things we didnâ€™t reuse when we had the chance.  I donâ€™t think we ever re-used bumpers from one year to another because we didnâ€™t repeat dimensions, and we always did bumpers that covered the entire frame perimeter  except for gaps specifically sized for that yearâ€™s game
